DataElement.preferredName: Ophthalmologist Confirmation Dry Eye Syndrome Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not dry eye syndrome was confirmed by an ophthalmologist.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ophthalmologist Confirmation Dry Eye Syndrome Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye problems, including injury and disease._Having been established or verified._A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye problems, including injury and disease.:Having been established or verified.:A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.

Concepts.definition: A physician with a Doctor of Medicine or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree (or analogous) who specializes in diagnosing and treating eye disorders, including more complex disorders that require surgery.

A syndrome characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva. It is usually caused by a deficiency in tear production. Symptoms include a feeling of burning eyes and a possible foreign body presence in the eye.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
